alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 12:27PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Above Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt any available high mountain snowpack, allowing for continued elevated river flows. For the Upper Humboldt...including Test - Elko, Elko, Carlin... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River Above Carlin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, This is monitoring stage. No flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:10 PM PDT Monday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
